intro: Lecythis amazonum, commonly known as the Amazonian starfruit, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces a unique, spiky fruit that contains a sweet, edible pulp surrounded by a hard, woody shell. Its fruit is often consumed fresh or used in traditional remedies. The plant plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and maintaining forest biodiversity.
